reviewText: None of the screen cowboys come much better than Roy Rogers. Good entertaining fun. I was not around for the movie serials and early tv westerns and only saw these as reruns but they are still a hoot,

reviewText: I am kind of new to Roy Rogers but love his movies.  This wasn't my favorite but I did still loved it.  So glad to have found this for my collection.
summary: Roy Rogers is Still King of the Cowboys!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Springtime in the Sierras is a great return to the Saturday Matinees of my youth. I always liked the Trucolor movies of Roy Rogers. It didn't have to be Technicolor, his movies had their own stamp. Roy and Trigger always looked sharp and colorful while riding the range or chasing outlaws.It's a joy to watch, hope there will be somemore restorations in the near future.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Jason P. Pumphrey "the movie & music man"
reviewText: This is great restored  color version of the classic Roy Rogers and Trigger film.Film Chest did a great job with the restoration using an original 16MM pint, just dont expect it to look like The Searchers or other big budget filmed western.This is the full 75 minute version of Springtime in the Sierras.They also added a super cool bonus, and episode of The Chevy Show, hosted by Roy Rogers and Dale Evans, with guests, Charley Weaver, Eddie Arnold, George Maharis, Martin Milner, and the Limeliters.Very recommended!
summary: great color restoration from Film Chest!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Unlike most R/R movies this one appears to be near the original release. Most are cut versions cut to run as 1 hour tv shows, and in black & white, Usually the songs are shortened or eliminated completely because of time restraints. Color is good, picture is good, being  from a 16mm print. (Tv again?)). All in al though this is the best of version of one of his westerns I have seen.  I wish someone would do for the Rogers fans what has been done with the Autry films. There are some very fine restorations of them on a cable movie channell.The bonus Chevy show is a nice addition.
summary: Roy Rogers restored, yes, pretty well done
Title: N/A

reviewText: Another one of those later Roy Rogers movies originaly filmed in Republic Pictures'TruColor format, but thought to be lost except for black and white prints. This is a great discovery. Here's hoping that more of these color prints begin to surface for the remainder of the films that were also shot in color.
